['On tap - Indicates direct availability, as with a bar tap and beverages.', 'Abundant - Suggesting more than enough supply is at hand.', 'Accessible - Signifying easy approach or use.', 'Instantly obtainable - Emphasizing the speed of accessibility.', 'Immediate - Implying no delay in availability.', 'On demand - Referring to products or services available as requested.', 'At-hand - Denotes something that is currently within reach.', 'Handy - Suggests both convenience and readiness for use.', 'Quickly available - Focuses on the rapidity of obtainment.', 'Promptly available - Similar to quickly, but with a formal tone.', 'Unfed - The most straightforward description of not having eaten.', 'Starving - A more intense form of hunger typically associated with a longer period without food.', 'Famished - An informal term for extreme hunger, often used to express urgency or need.', 'Empty belly - A visual and physical representation of being left hungry.', 'Underfed - Implies not receiving sufficient nutrition over time.', 'Food insecurity - The state of being without reliable access to a sufficient quantity of affordable, nutritious food.', 'Picky eater (when unintended) - Refers indirectly; if one is selective about their diet, they might end up hungry if options are limited.', 'Vitamin deficiency - While not directly related to hunger, it can be a result of lacking access to nutritious food.', 'Malnourished - More severe than underfed; lacks necessary nourishment over time.', 'Lean and gaunt (due to lack of food) - Describes physical appearance resulting from prolonged hunger or malnutrition.']
